main event: A pilot for Patten Motor Company reported a sighting of a round, white object moving rapidly while flying at 6,000 feet on December 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was moving at an estimated speed of 500-600 mph.,The pilot and copilot observed the object for about half an hour.,The sighting occurred while en route from a VHF CG light station to Old Fortuna.,The sighting was documented but no conclusions were drawn regarding the object's nature.,On December 28, 1957, another sighting of a round, bright white light occurred in South Pass, Louisiana, lasting 1.5 hours.
